content.text: This epic aims to implement an automated migration orchestrator that ensures the seamless transfer of work items, custom fields, workflows, statuses, test cases, and related artifacts from Jira and Zephyr to Azure DevOps. The migration will prioritize data precision, maintain traceability through frontend logging, and operate within a fully automated pipeline. This initiative supports the strategic goal of optimizing project management by consolidating tools and improving workflow efficiency within the organization.
Business Outcome Hypothesis
By automating the migration process with a focus on accuracy and traceability, we expect to:
Reduce manual effort and errors associated with data migration.
Improve project tracking and continuity within Azure DevOps.
Ensure compliance with organizational data integrity standards.
Enable a seamless transition with minimal operational disruptions.
Leading Indicators
Successful validation of migrated work items and test artifacts in Azure DevOps.
Reduction in migration-related defects or inconsistencies.
Increased stakeholder confidence in the migration process.
Real-time logging and monitoring available via the frontend.
Non-Functional Requirements (NFRs)
Data Accuracy:
Ensure 100% consistency between Jira, Zephyr, and Azure DevOps.
Performance:
The migration should be completed within the defined SLA.
Traceability:
Maintain detailed logs in the frontend for error tracking and auditing.
Security Compliance:
Ensure proper authentication and authorization for API interactions.
Automation:
No manual intervention should be required post-execution.
Scope and Features
The following features will be developed to support the migration:
1. Work Item Migration
Read and extract issue types, custom fields, and statuses from Jira.
Validate and transform data according to Azure DevOps work item types.
Write and confirm successful migration of work items to Azure DevOps.
2. Workflow Migration
Extract Jira workflows and status transitions.
Map and validate workflows against Azure DevOps processes.
Write and confirm successful migration of workflows.
3. UI Screens and Custom Fields Migration
Extract screens, tabs, and custom fields from Jira.
Validate and map custom fields for Azure DevOps compatibility.
Write and confirm successful migration of screens and fields.
4. Test Management Migration (Zephyr to Azure DevOps)
Read test cases, test plans, and test cycles from Zephyr.
Validate and transform data for Azure DevOps Test Plans and Suites.
Write and confirm successful migration of test artifacts.
5. Comments and Attachments Migration
Extract issue comments and attachments from Jira.
Validate and transform comments and file formats as needed.
Write and confirm successful migration of comments and attachments.
6. Logging and Error Handling
Provide real-time logging and validation at the frontend.
Implement structured logging for auditing and debugging.
Ensure proper error handling and retries for failed migrations.
Constraints and Assumptions
Migration will be limited to a specific project scope.
The source data structure in Jira and Zephyr is assumed to be stable.
Any required API integrations for Jira, Zephyr, and Azure DevOps will be accessible.
Azure DevOps configurations will be pre-defined before migration execution.
Dependencies
Availability of API access to Jira, Zephyr, and Azure DevOps.
Coordination with platform teams to ensure Azure DevOps readiness.
Verification from business users for validation of migrated data.
Risks and Mitigations
Risk
Mitigation Strategy
Data loss or corruption
Implement robust validation and logging mechanisms before committing changes.
API rate limits or access issues
Coordinate with Atlassian and Microsoft for API quotas and credentials.
Unexpected schema changes in Jira/Zephyr
Conduct preliminary data analysis and implement flexible data mappings.
Inconsistencies in migrated workflows
Perform dry-run migrations and allow iterative refinements.
Acceptance Criteria
All work items, test cases, and related data are successfully migrated and validated.
Logs are available in the frontend with detailed status and error reporting.
No manual intervention is required after migration initiation.
Azure DevOps reflects the expected data structure and relationships post-migration.
Approval Process
Business Owner sign-off after validating the migration results.
Technical and functional validation performed by stakeholders.
Compliance review ensuring data integrity and security standards are met

fields.summary: Perform hands-on testing in Jira and Zephyr
Improve test cases design and coverage

content.text: As a Quality Assurance Engineer, I want to research and improve test cases to ensure better testing coverage, accuracy, and efficiency. This includes enhancing my knowledge of Jira and Zephyr, refining test case design, and improving collaboration with the development team for more effective issue tracking and validation.
Use Case:
As a Quality Assurance Engineer,
I want to enhance my test case development process and optimize test execution using Jira and Zephyr,
so that I can ensure more structured, efficient, and comprehensive software testing.
Acceptance Criteria:
GIVEN
that Jira and Zephyr are properly configured,
WHEN
test cases are created, executed, and reviewed using these tools,
AND
best practices for test case design and execution are applied,
THEN
the testing process is considered improved, ensuring better validation and tracking of issues.
Technical Notes:
Test cases must cover key functionalities of Jira and Zephyr, including test creation, execution, and tracking.
Security best practices should be followed to handle project data and avoid accidental exposure.
Error handling mechanisms for test execution failures should be documented and tested.
Integration between test cases and development workflows should be reviewed to ensure smooth collaboration with the dev team.

fields.summary: Transmit Data Securely to Node.js Backend

Setup Jira Cloud API Integration in React Front End

content.text: As a front-end developer, I want to simulate the migration process using mock data so that I can test UI behavior and ensure real-time updates.
Description:

Before integrating with the actual backend, the migration process should be simulated using mock data. This involves defining a sequence of migration steps (e.g., "Fetching data", "Uploading data") and using
setInterval
to update the progress and log messages over time. The simulation will help validate UI responsiveness and ensure that users receive accurate feedback during the migration process.
Acceptance Criteria:
A
sequence of migration steps
(e.g., "Fetching data", "Uploading data", "Finalizing migration") is defined.
The
progress bar updates dynamically
based on the simulated migration steps.
Log messages are appended and displayed
in real-time
as the migration progresses.
The simulation is implemented using
setInterval
to mimic actual timing behavior.
The UI remains
responsive and user-friendly
throughout the simulated process.
The implementation follows
best practices for state management
in React (e.g.,
useState
Dependencies:
UI components for progress tracking and logging.
Design guidelines for migration feedback.
Business Value:
Simulating the migration process before backend integration helps identify UI issues early, ensures real-time feedback mechanisms work correctly, and improves the overall user experience.
As a front-end developer, I want to implement state variables to track progress and log messages so that the UI dynamically reflects migration updates.
Description:

The migration UI should maintain and update the progress percentage and log messages in real time. State management will ensure that users receive accurate feedback on migration status, improving transparency and usability.
Acceptance Criteria:
A
state variable
is implemented to track the progress percentage of the migration.
A
state variable
is implemented to store and update log messages dynamically.
Progress updates in the UI as the migration advances.
Log messages are appended and displayed in real time.
The implementation follows
React best practices
for state management (e.g.,
useState
useReducer
, or context if needed).
The solution is tested to ensure correct state updates and UI responsiveness.
Dependencies:
Existing migration logic and UI components.
State management library (if needed).
Business Value:
Proper state management ensures accurate real-time updates, enhances user experience, and prevents UI inconsistencies during the migration process.
As a front-end developer, I want to implement a progress bar, a log section, and a clean UI so that users can track the migration process effectively.
Description:
The migration interface should provide clear visual feedback to users. A
progress bar
should indicate migration status, while a
log section
should display real-time updates, errors, and success messages. The UI should be well-structured and styled for readability and usability.
Acceptance Criteria:
A
React component for the progress bar
is created.
A
log section
is implemented to display migration messages in real time.
Messages include
status updates, errors, and success notifications
The implementation follows
responsive design principles
The updated UI is reviewed and approved by stakeholders.
Dependencies:
UI/UX design guidelines.
Business Value:
A well-designed UI improves the user experience by providing
clear visual indicators
of the migration process, reducing confusion, and ensuring transparency.

fields.summary: [Frontend] Implementation of Loading Bar of Migration Progress in Real Time

content.text: Use case:
As a user overseeing a data migration, I want to see a real-time progress bar so that I can monitor the migration's progress and estimate the remaining time.
Acceptance criteria:
A loading bar must be displayed on the migration progress page.
The loading bar must update in real-time to reflect the current status of the migration.
The progress percentage must be displayed alongside the loading bar.
The loading bar must be visually distinct and easy to interpret.
The loading bar must handle errors gracefully and inform the user if the migration process encounters issues.
Technical notes:
Implement the loading bar using either WebSocket connections or polling to fetch real-time migration status updates from the backend.
If using WebSockets: Utilize a WebSocket connection to stream updates in real-time.
If using polling: Implement a polling mechanism that requests status updates at regular intervals (e.g., every few seconds).
Ensure compatibility with React.
Implement error handling and fallback mechanisms for both WebSocket and polling approaches.
Consider performance implications and optimize the loading bar for minimal impact on frontend performance.
Design the loading bar to be responsive and accessible, ensuring it works well on various devices and screen sizes.

fields.summary: [Backend] Real Time Progress Update of Migration Progress to Frontend

content.text: Use case:

As a user overseeing a data migration, I want the backend to send real-time progress updates to the frontend so that I can monitor the migration's progress and see an accurate representation on the loading bar.
Acceptance criteria:
The backend must stream real-time migration progress updates to the frontend.
The progress updates must include detailed status information such as percentage completed and any relevant messages or errors.
The updates must be delivered at regular intervals to ensure smooth real-time tracking.
The backend must handle any errors or interruptions in the migration process and send appropriate notifications to the frontend.
The system must ensure data consistency and integrity during the migration process.
Technical notes:
Implement the progress update mechanism using either WebSocket connections or polling to push updates to the frontend.
If using WebSockets: Establish a WebSocket server to send real-time updates to connected clients.
If using polling: Implement an API endpoint that clients can call at regular intervals to fetch the latest progress updates.
Ensure the progress updates include necessary information such as migration status, percentage completed, and error messages (if any).
Implement error handling and recovery mechanisms to ensure reliable updates in case of network or system failures.
Optimize the backend service for performance to minimize latency and ensure timely delivery of progress updates.
Ensure the progress update mechanism is scalable to handle multiple concurrent migrations and clients.

content.text: Description:
Simulate a successful connection to the Jira Cloud API using mocks. Validate that the connection is established correctly and that the expected data is returned without making actual API calls.
Key Features:
Mock API responses to simulate a successful authentication and data retrieval.
Ensure the component or function correctly processes the response.
Write unit tests to validate that the connection logic functions as expected.
Acceptance Criteria:
API responses are successfully mocked and return expected data.
Tests validate that the connection logic correctly processes API responses.
No actual requests are sent to the Jira Cloud API during testing.
The implementation follows best practices for mocking and unit testing.
Technical Notes:
Use appropriate mocking libraries (e.g., nock for Node.js, responses for Python, Mockito for Java).
Ensure API authentication and data retrieval logic are tested independently.
Document the testing approach and results in Confluence.
Description:

Configure the necessary environment to run unit tests for the Jira API connection. This includes installing the test framework, setting up mocking tools, and enabling code coverage metrics to ensure the reliability of the testing setup.
Key Features:
Install and configure a testing framework (e.g., Jest, JUnit, or Pytest).
Set up mocking/stubbing tools for API request simulations.
Enable code coverage metrics to track test effectiveness.
Acceptance Criteria:
The test framework is correctly installed and integrated into the project.
Mocking tools are set up and ready to simulate API responses.
Code coverage is enabled and measurable within the test reports.
A basic test runs successfully to confirm the setup.
Technical Notes:
Use industry-standard libraries for unit testing and mocking based on the project’s tech stack.
Ensure tests run in isolation without relying on external APIs.
Document the setup steps in Confluence for future reference.

This subtask focuses on converting the approved migration UI mockups into an interactive interface. The new migrate UI should be developed according to the design specifications, ensuring that it is responsive, intuitive, and aligned with the overall platform branding. The implementation will involve coding the layout and integrating basic functionality.
The goal is to ensure that the migration UI is seamless, easy to use, and reliable, allowing users to perform the migration without confusion or difficulty.
Acceptance Criteria:
UI Implementation
: The migration UI is implemented based on the approved mockups, with all UI components styled according to the design system.
Responsive Design
: The migration UI is fully responsive and works correctly.
Data Migration Functionality
: The UI is integrated with the backend to correctly handle data migration processes, with all relevant steps clearly presented to the user.
Branding Compliance
: The migration UI follows the platform’s branding guidelines, ensuring a cohesive visual experience.
Dependencies:
Feedback from stakeholders.
Business Value:

Implementing a well-functioning, user-friendly migration UI ensures that users can easily migrate their data without complications. It contributes to a smoother transition process, fostering user trust and improving satisfaction with the platform.

The purpose of this subtask is to design mockups for the user interface (UI) associated with the migration process. This UI should guide the user through the migration of their data securely and seamlessly. The design should present the migration flow in a clear, straightforward manner. The UI should ensure users feel confident that their data is being safely handled while maintaining a smooth experience throughout the migration. It must also align with the overall platform design and be responsive across various devices.
The mockups will act as the visual blueprint for the development of the migration UI and will be reviewed and approved by the design team and key stakeholders before implementation.
Acceptance Criteria:
Clarity and Simplicity
: The migration UI is simple, intuitive, and easy to follow, guiding users through each step of the process.
Responsive Design
: The migration UI is designed to be responsive.
Accessibility
: The design follows accessibility guidelines (e.g., color contrast, readable fonts) to ensure usability for all users.
Branding Alignment
: The migration UI follows the platform’s branding guidelines (colors, fonts, visual elements).
Stakeholder Approval
: The design is reviewed and approved by the design team and key stakeholders before the development phase begins.
Dependencies:
Branding guidelines and assets (colors, fonts, logos).
Feedback from product owners or stakeholders on the user flow and key features.
Business Value:

A well-designed migration UI improves the user experience during potentially stressful data transitions, providing clear, reliable information. It helps maintain trust with users and ensures the platform’s migration process is perceived as secure, seamless, and professional.

fields.summary: Set up theme variables for colors, fonts, and spacing.
Improve the typography hierarchy for better readability.
Apply box shadows and rounded corners to cards.

content.text: As a developer, I want to apply consistent and modern styling to UI components so that the platform looks professional and cohesive.
Description:

The UI components should follow a standardized design system to ensure a seamless user experience. This includes using a modern styling approach with consistent colors, typography, spacing, and responsiveness. The implementation should align with the platform’s branding and design guidelines.
Acceptance Criteria:
Consistent typography, colors, and spacing
are applied across all components.
Responsive design principles
are implemented for different screen sizes.
Styles are applied in a
scalable and maintainable
manner (e.g., utility classes, theme-based styling).
The updated UI is reviewed and approved by the design team.
Dependencies:
UI/UX design guidelines.
Branding assets (colors, fonts, spacing standards).
Feedback from stakeholders and end users.
Business Value:
A consistent and modern UI improves user engagement, enhances brand perception, and ensures a professional and cohesive platform experience.
